title: Correlating Historical and Literary Contexts
objective: Integrate historical background with literary shape to form a stable meaning hypothesis

segments.audio_script: This is lesson six. We integrate historical background with literary structure.
No passage required. Practice outlining argument flow and historical issues together.
Combine internal textual evidence with external historical data. The intersection narrows plausible meanings and prevents speculation.
Formulate a meaning hypothesis grounded on textual features and historical support. Mark evidential confidence levels.
Key skill: correlate data sources and prefer readings supported by both text and history.
What is a stable meaning hypothesis based on?
This completes lesson six. Unit One complete. Next unit begins genre analysis.

vocabulary.definition: A textually-grounded proposal about what a passage means

study_notes: Record hypotheses and their evidence. Good scholarship notes degrees of confidence.
